intro: Parosela polycephala, commonly known as the many-headed parosela, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in complex clusters. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a feathery appearance, and it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Parosela polycephala is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to the arid climate of its native habitat.
